What Mylar and Eclipse version is this?

Eclipse 3.2M4, Mylar 0.4.6.1. Was just about to append this:

eclipse.buildId=I20051215-1506
java.version=1.5.0_04
java.vendor=BEA Systems, Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=no_NO
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -data C:\home\config\eclipse
Does this cause any bad behavior?  E.g. reactivating the task after startup might be a sufficient work-around.
Can't answer that yet as 3.2M4 is proving too unstable in other ways to work/test reliably with at the moment. Also, it has only happened once so far.
Just curious, what problems are you having with 3.2M4?

(In reply to comment #5)
> Just curious, what problems are you having with 3.2M4?

Aside from these Mylar problems (bug 121442 in particular; Active Search has always made Eclipse unusable for me, but this time it's insane), first, all my perspectives were reset when I started 3.2M4 for the first time. Also I'm being peeved by some other weird elusive errors; the error in bug 121483 is the only one solid enough to shape into a bug report, and even that one probably isn't reproducible. More seriously, like in certain earlier milestones, there's a resource leak that has SWT running out of handles (and Eclipse growing increasingly sluggish).
